intro: Bursa abscissa, commonly known as the common bursa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that splits open to release seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
